title: ICCV_2003_161_abs

sentences.text: The perception of transparent objects from images is known to be a very hard problem in vision .
Given a single image , it is difficult to even detect the presence of transparent objects in the scene .
In this paper , we explore what can be said about transparent objects by a moving observer .
We show how features that are imaged through a transparent object behave differently from those that are rigidly attached to the scene .
We present a novel model-based approach to recover the shapes and the poses of transparent objects from known motion .
The objects can be complex in that they may be composed of multiple layers with different refractive indices .
We have conducted numerous simulations to verify the practical feasibility of our algorithm .
We have applied it to real scenes that include transparent objects and recovered the shapes of the objects with high accuracy .

summary: The perception of transparent objects from images is known to be a very hard problem in vision . Given a single image , it is difficult to even detect the presence of transparent objects in the scene . In this paper , we explore what can be said about transparent objects by a moving observer . We show how features that are imaged through a transparent object behave differently from those that are rigidly attached to the scene . We present a novel model-based approach to recover the shapes and the poses of transparent objects from known motion . The objects can be complex in that they may be composed of multiple layers with different refractive indices . We have conducted numerous simulations to verify the practical feasibility of our algorithm . We have applied it to real scenes that include transparent objects and recovered the shapes of the objects with high accuracy .

Predicate-is_known_to_be_a.label: is known to be a
Predicate-is_known_to_be_a.description: This predicate indicates that there exists some established or recognized connection between the subject and object. The subject has been identified as being of a certain type or category, which is described by the object. This connection can be based on various factors such as definition, classification, understanding, or perception.

Predicate-is_known_to_be_a_very_hard_pro.label: is known to be a very hard problem in
Predicate-is_known_to_be_a_very_hard_pro.description: This predicate indicates that the subject represents an area or field where solving the object (a specific problem) requires significant effort and expertise. The phrase 'is known to be a very hard problem in' suggests that this difficulty is widely recognized within the relevant domain, making it a characteristic of the subject's nature.

Predicate-behave_differently_from.label: behave differently from
Predicate-behave_differently_from.description: The predicate 'behave differently from' indicates a contrast or distinction between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject exhibits distinct characteristics, patterns, or behaviors that differ significantly from those of the object.

Predicate-are_imaged_through.label: are imaged through
Predicate-are_imaged_through.description: The predicate 'are imaged through' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g., transparent objects) serves as a medium or means by which certain characteristics, properties, or aspects are perceived, represented, or understood. The object of this predicate represents these perceivable features that are made visible or intelligible due to the presence and nature of the subject.

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: The predicate 'present' indicates that the subject is introducing or showcasing something new, often with a sense of novelty, innovation, or significance. It suggests that the object being presented has some unique value, insight, or perspective to offer.

Predicate-can_be_complex_in_that_they_ma.label: can be complex in that they may be composed of
Predicate-can_be_complex_in_that_they_ma.description: This predicate indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject has the potential to exhibit complexity due to its composition. The phrase 'can be complex in that they may be composed of' suggests that the subject's internal structure or makeup can contribute to its complexity, making it more intricate or multifaceted.

Predicate-have.label: have
Predicate-have.description: The predicate 'have' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject possesses or holds the property or characteristic described by the object. This can imply ownership, possession, existence, or attribution of the quality or quantity denoted by the object.

Predicate-have_conducted.label: have conducted
Predicate-have_conducted.description: To indicate that the subject has performed or carried out a specific action or activity on the object. The predicate 'have conducted' implies a sense of completion and accomplishment, suggesting that the subject has successfully executed the action described by the object.

Predicate-applied.label: applied
Predicate-applied.description: The predicate 'applied' indicates that the subject has utilized or put into practice an idea, concept, method, or approach to achieve a specific goal or solve a problem. It implies a sense of implementation, execution, or utilization.

Predicate-include.label: include
Predicate-include.description: The predicate 'include' indicates a relationship of containment or membership between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject encompasses or comprises the object, implying a whole-part or category-member connection.

Predicate-recovered.label: recovered
Predicate-recovered.description: To recover means to regain or restore something, often after a process of deterioration, damage, or loss. In this sense, it implies that the subject has taken action to retrieve or re-establish the object in its original state or with its original characteristics.

Predicate-show.label: show
Predicate-show.description: The predicate 'show' indicates the act of revealing or demonstrating something, often in a visual or illustrative manner. It connects the subject and object by highlighting the key aspects or characteristics of the object, providing insight into its nature, properties, or behavior.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or category within a larger class or domain defined by the object. In other words, it establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject represents a more detailed or specialized concept within the scope of the object.
